poem:
### Errata

In the quiet margin,  
truth stumbles on precision.  
Cameron, a misstep;  
Heckerling's vision illuminated.  
Loyalty misjudged in print,  
the Co-op's currency  
weighs one-off,  
like our small corrections,  
Which hide beneath  
the day's ink-stained skin.  
In the end,  
all words wait  
for the grace of  
a clarified dawn.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • A review of Cameron Crowe’s memoir The Uncool in today’s pre‑printed Saturday magazine said that Crowe wrote and directed the film Fast Times at Ridgemont High (Access all areas, p51). In fact, Amy Heckerling was the director. • An article (Does loyalty really pay when it comes to a weekly shop?, 11 October, p42) misstated details of the Co-op’s loyalty scheme. The £1 fee is one-off, not annual, and can be claimed back". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
